Crimes.Crime_Name: Unjust Dismissal under Canada Labour Code
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can an employee withdraw their unjust dismissal complaint without prejudice to other civil claims?
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Adjudicator's consideration of potential prejudice to the bank
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Section 246(1) of the Canada Labour Code: employees retain civil remedies after filing a complaint
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Withdrawal of complaint and adjudicator’s jurisdiction
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Not reached due to jurisdictional issue
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Adjudicator under the Canada Labour Code
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Withdrawal of complaint, initiation of civil action, dropping of criminal charges
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Canada Labour Code, Part III – Unjust Dismissal
Crimes.Court_Result: Evidentiary decision dismissed; withdrawal decision quashed
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Bank argued potential prejudice if complaint withdrawn
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Withdrawal of complaint to pursue civil remedies
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Administrative tribunal process under federal labour law

Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Adjudicator's decision to deny withdrawal quashed
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate right to withdrawal

Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Fraud over $5000, linked to unjust dismissal context
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided – focus on procedural jurisdiction
